sense.name: Cause a liquid to spatter about, perhaps producing a sound; mark or overlay as with a liquid.
sense.examples: Water was splashing on the floor. Rain splashed over the awnings. The mother splashed the baby's face with water. Snow patches splashed the side of the mountain.

sense.name: Move around inside a liquid; traverse a liquid/something liquid-like, perhaps producing a sound.
sense.examples: We had to splash across the wet meadow. The boys splashed around in the pool. We splashed in the surf. She splashed the water around her.

sense.name: Apply something abstract as if by spattering.
sense.examples: He splashed the information on handbills that he distributed around town. I splashed a few final phrases on the page and handed in the exam.
